title: How does Toyz technique work? Is it worth knowing? - Some background information
body:
Hello OCE League community, my main question today is- 
Wow does the Toyz technique work? How is it done? And what does it achieve?

I saw some videos on it and thought it was quite interesting.
For those who don't know, I believe it's something to do with increasing the range of abilities by rapid input of movement in a specific pattern during the animation of the ability(?)
It has been mentioned that it can be used on champions like Thresh and Blitzcrank, and that it was discovered by Toyz (hence the name) on Orianna.
I've searched through the internet to try find it but it seems I've hit a dead end.

**Links:**
Here, an informational League of Legends YouTuber (Bodytags) uploaded a video of it, which was later corrected by a high level coach (LastShadow9). But all the videos doesn't specifically show how it's done.
Wrong:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XveH_iZzMpU
Corrected:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1bnslWIsvT8

Here's another one of LastShadow's coaching videos which goes over a little bit of the Toyz technique. (23:47)
Coaching video (Toyz technique part at 23:47): 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hdeA78r9cUk

Apologies for my poor English. My mother tongue language is Korean.

replies.body:
Just as a note, from what was said in the videos, your going to get about an extra 25 units of range, which isn't all that effective for doing much in anything below like plat+

I don't think anyone has an actual good reference to how to make the Toyz technique work either (because it's not worth all that much.)
